metadata.title: CVE-2023-1390 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A remote denial of service vulnerability was found in the Linux kernelâ€™sTIPC kernel module. The while loop in tipc_link_xmit() hits an unknownstate while attempting to parse SKBs, which are not in the queue. Sendingtwo small UDP packets to a system with a UDP bearer results in the CPUutilization for the system to instantly spike to 100%, causing a denial ofservice condition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1390` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-240-generic - 4.4.0-240.274
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-240-generic - 4.4.0-240.274
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-240-lowlatency - 4.4.0-240.274
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-137.141~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-137.141~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-137.141~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1119-kvm - 4.4.0-1119.129
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1156-aws - 4.4.0-1156.171
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1095.102~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1109.121~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1094.107~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1066.74~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-240.274').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-137.141~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1119.129').

linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1094.107~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1066.74~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
